abstract: An international arbitration panel says that Venezuela must pay Exxon Mobil for assets it nationalized in the Orinoco Belt, a region rich with heavy oil deposits.
snippet: An international arbitration panel says that Venezuela must pay Exxon Mobil for assets it nationalized in the Orinoco Belt, a region rich with heavy oil deposits.
lead_paragraph: An international arbitration panel has ruled that Venezuela must pay Exxon Mobil more than $900 million in a long-simmering dispute over the nationalization of Exxon’s assets in Venezuela’s Orinoco Belt, one of the most coveted oil reserves outside the Middle East.

headline.main: Venezuela Is Ordered to Pay $900 Million to Exxon Mobil
headline.print_headline: Venezuela Is Ordered to Pay $900 Million to Exxon Mobil
